meanings.definition: The process of making someone less sensitive to something, typically through repeated exposure.
meanings.sent1: After many desensitizations to horror movies, she no longer jumped at scary scenes.
meanings.sent2: The desensitizations to loud noises helped him cope better with his sound sensitivity.
meanings.sent3: His desensitizations to spicy food made him the champion of the hot wing eating contest.
meanings.sent4: The desensitizations to rejection slowly hardened his heart against emotional pain.
meanings.sent5: Through desensitizations to public speaking, she conquered her fear and became a confident presenter.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the sensitivity of a particular area or system in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended desensitizations to alleviate the pain in her sensitive tooth.
meanings.sent2: Regular desensitizations helped manage the discomfort in his hypersensitive skin.
meanings.sent3: His desensitizations to tickling made him immune to his little sister's attempts to make him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The desensitizations to allergens allowed him to enjoy the outdoors without fear of a reaction.
meanings.sent5: Through desensitizations to cold temperatures, he could now withstand icy weather without shivering.
